module.name: laznumedit
module.short: Implements an edit control specialized for Integer values with a specific numeric base (radix).

element.name: TLazIntegerEditBaseChangeEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when the numeric base (radix) for an Integer edit control is changed.

descr.p: TLazIntegerEditBaseChangeEvent is the type used for the OnBaseChange property in TLazIntegerEditGen and TLazIntegerEdit. It allows actions to be performed when the numeric base (radix) for an integer edit control is changed.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditBaseChangeEvent.ASender
element.short: Control for the event notification.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditBaseChangeEvent.ACurrentBase
element.short: Current numeric base for the notification.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditBaseChangeEvent.ANewBase
element.short: New numeric base for the notification.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditBaseChangeEvent.APrefix
element.short: Optional prefix for the new numeric base.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen
element.short: Defines the base class for an Integer edit control using a specified numeric base.

descr.p: TLazIntegerEditGen is the generic base class for an edit control which can display and edit a 64-bit integer value using a specified numeric base or radix. TLazIntegerEditGen is the ancestor for the TLazIntegerEdit type which specializes the ancestor for the TCustomEdit type.
TLazIntegerEditGen introduces properties which determine the appearance and editing behavior for the control, including: Value, MinValue, MaxValue, and DisplayBase.

Value contains the decimal (base-10) value for the control as an Int64 type. MinValue and MaxValue control the lower and upper limits for the value in the control. DisplayBase determines the numeric base (base-2, base-8, base-16, etc.) used to display and edit the text for for the control.

Changing the value in DisplayBase causes the Value to be converted to the specified numeric base and the control is updated. A prefix is displayed for some numeric base values like base-2 (binary), base-8 (octal) and base-16 (hexadecimal). Other numeric base values do not use a prefix.
The edit control supports changing the numeric base using DisplayBase, or using key presses which force the radix to be changed. See ToggleBinKeys, ToggleOctKeys, ToggleHexKeys for more information.
Use the OnBasechange event handler to perform actions needed when DisplayBase is changed for the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.Min_limit
element.short: Lower limit for the Int64 value in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.Max_limit
element.short: Upper limit for the Int64 value in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._KeyDown
element.short: Implements an alternate KeyDown method used in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._KeyDown.Key
element.short: Virtual key code for the key down notification.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._KeyDown.Shift
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, or Meta modifier(s) for the key code.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._KeyPress
element.short: Implements an alternate KeyPress method used in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._KeyPress.Key
element.short: Character value for the key press notification.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._Utf8KeyPress
element.short: Implements an alternate UTF8KeyPress method used in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._Utf8KeyPress.UTF8Key
element.short: UTF-8 character value for the key press notification.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._InitializeWnd
element.short: Implements an alternate InitializeWnd method used in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._RealGetText
element.short: Implements an alternate RealGetText method used in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._RealGetText.Result
element.short: Caption text displayed in the edit box for the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._FinalizeWnd
element.short: Implements an alternate FinalizeWnd method used in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._DoExit
element.short: Implements an alternate DoExit method used in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._EditingDone
element.short: Implements an alternate EditingDone method used in the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen._Init
element.short: Implements an initialization routine used for new instances of the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.Value
element.short: Value for the control as an Int64 type.

descr.p: Value is an Int64 property which contains the decimal (base-10) value for the control. Changing the property value causes the display Text in the control to be updated and redisplayed. DisplayBase determines the numeric base (radix) for the converted control Value. An optional prefix is used for numeric base values in DisplayBase like base-2 (binary), base-8 (octal), and base-16 (hexadecimal).

Use MinValue and MaxValue to set lower and upper limits for the control Value. Changing the property causes the new value to be normalized for the limits in MinValue and MaxValue; if the new value is not in the specified range, it is changed to the corresponding lower or upper limit.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.CurrentValue
element.short: Value for the control before EditingDone is called or the control loses focus.

descr.p: CurrentValue is a read-only Int64 property which contains the control value while editing is active and before the control loses focus. The property value is derived by reading the Text in the edit box and converting it from the selected DisplayBase back to a decimal (base-10) value. If a handle has not been allocated for the contro, the Value property is used instead.
Use Valid to determine if the edit box contains a valid value for the specified DisplayBase.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.Valid
element.short: Indicates whether the value in the CurrentValue property is valid for the selected DisplayBase.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.MinValue
element.short: Contains the lower limit for the Value property.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.MaxValue
element.short: Contains the upper limit for the Value property.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.DisplayBase
element.short: Contains the numeric base (radix) for the value displayed in the control.

descr.p: DisplayBase is an Integer property which contains the numeric base (or radix) for the value displayed and maintained in the edit control.

DisplayBase determines the number of digits used to represent the Value in the control and controls the conversion performed to get the display value. The default value for the property is 10 and indicates the control displays its Value using base-10 or decimal notation.
DisplayBase must be in the range 2..35; a value outside this range is normalized to the lower or upper limit.

Changing the value for the property causes the OnBaseChange event handler to be signalled (when assigned) using the old and new values for the property and the optional prefix for the new numeric base (radix).

The Text for control is updated by converting Value to the specified radix and applying the prefix for the DisplayBase. See BinIndicator, OctIndicator, and HexIndicator for more information about common prefixes used for selected DisplayBase values.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.SetDecimalKeys
element.short: Contains the characters or keys which can be applied to the edit control for a value using the decimal (base-10) radix.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.HexIndicator
element.short: Contains the prefix used for a control value displayed in hexadecimal format (DisplayBase = 16).

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.SetHexKeys
element.short: Contains the characters or keys which can be applied to the edit control for a value using the hexadecimal (base-16) radix.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.ToggleHexKeys
element.short: Contains key(s) which cause the DisplayBase to be toggled between decimal (10) and hexadecimal (16) display formats.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.OctIndicator
element.short: Contains the prefix used for a control value displayed in octal format (DisplayBase = 8).

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.SetOctKeys
element.short: Contains the characters or keys which can be applied to the edit control for a value using the octal (base-8) radix.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.ToggleOctKeys
element.short: Contains key(s) which cause the DisplayBase to be toggled between decimal (10) and octal (8) display formats.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.BinIndicator
element.short: Contains the prefix used for a control value displayed in binary format (DisplayBase = 2).

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.SetBinKeys
element.short: Contains the characters or keys which can be applied to the edit control for a value using the binary (base-2) radix.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.ToggleBinKeys
element.short: Contains key(s) which cause the DisplayBase to be toggled between decimal (10) and binary (2) display formats.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.OnBaseChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when the value in DisplayBase is changed.

descr.p: OnBaseChange allows the control to perform actions needed when the value for the DisplayBase property is changed. It is signalled (when assigned) after the value in DisplayBase has been updated but before the Text in control is converted and displayed using the new radix. It allows the application to override the new numeric base or radix and prefix in the event handler.
See TLazIntegerEditBaseChangeEvent for more information about the handler type and its arguments.
OnBaseChange is a public property and does not appear in the Object Inspector at design-time; it must be assigned at run-time using an object procedure which implements the signature for the event.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.AllowMinus
element.short: Indicates whether the '-' key can be used when editing the control value.

element.name: TLazIntegerEditGen.AllowPlus
element.short: Indicates whether the '+' key can be used when editing the control value.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit
element.short: Implements an edit control for Integer values displayed and maintained using a specified numeric base or radix.

descr.p: TLazIntegerEdit is a TLazIntegerEdit descendant which specializes the generic base class for the TCustomEdit type. It implements an edit control which can display and edit a 64-bit integer value using a specified numeric base or radix.
TLazIntegerEdit introduces properties which determine the appearance and editing behavior for the control, including: Value, MinValue, MaxValue, and DisplayBase.

Value contains the decimal (base-10) value for the control as an Int64 type. MinValue and MaxValue control the lower and upper limits for the value in the control. DisplayBase determines the numeric base (base-2, base-8, base-16, etc.) used to display and edit the text for for the control.

Changing the value in DisplayBase causes the Value to be converted to the specified numeric base and the control is updated. A prefix is displayed for some numeric base values like base-2 (binary), base-8 (octal) and base-16 (hexadecimal). Other numeric base values do not use a prefix.
The edit control supports changing the numeric base using DisplayBase, or using key presses which force the radix to be changed. See ToggleBinKeys, ToggleOctKeys, ToggleHexKeys for more information.
Use the OnBasechange event handler to perform actions needed when DisplayBase is changed for the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.KeyDown
element.short: Handles key down events for the control.

descr.p: KeyDown is an overridden method in TLazIntegerEdit. It ensures that key down events which affect the current selection in the control are properly applied.

KeyDown calls the alternate handler in the ancestor class (_KeyDown) to signal assigned OnKeyDown event handler attached to the control. It updates the values in SelStart and SelLength as needed when VK_BACK or VK_DELETE key down events are received and applied to the edit box.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.KeyDown.Key
element.short: Virtual key code for the key down event.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.KeyDown.Shift
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, or Meta modifiers for the key down event.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.KeyPress
element.short: Handles key press events for the control.

descr.p: KeyPress is an overridden method in TLazIntegerEdit. It calls the alternate _KeyPress handler in TLazIntegerEditGen to signal OnKeyPress (when assigned) and apply the specified character to the control. No actions are performed when ReadOnly is set to True.
KeyPress ensures that keys specific to the control or its DisplayBase are detected and applied to the control. This includes control characters like:
Values in SelStart and SelLength are updated as needed when the Text in the control has been updated.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.KeyPress.Key
element.short: Character for the key press notification.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.Utf8KeyPress
element.short: Handles UTF-8-encoded key press events for the control.

descr.p: Ensures that multi-byte UTF-8 characters are ignored for the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.Utf8KeyPress.UTF8Key
element.short: UTF-8 character for the key press notification.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.RealGetText
element.short: Gets the text displayed in the control.

descr.p: Gets the value for the Text property using the handle for the control, or by converting Value to the required DisplayBase when a handle has not been assigned.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.RealGetText.Result
element.short: Value for the Text property.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.InitializeWnd
element.short: Updates the value in Text when the window handle is created.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.FinalizeWnd
element.short: Updates Value prior to freeing the window handle.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.DoExit
element.short: Updates Value with the contents of Text when the control loses input focus.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.EditingDone
element.short: Updates Value with the contents of Text when editing has been completed for the control.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. It calls the _Init method in the base class to set the default values for members in the class instance. It calls the inherited constructor (in TCustomEdit) to set the default values for members in TCustomEdit ancestor.

element.name: TLazIntegerEdit.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: Str2QWord
element.short: Converts the specified string to a QWord value using the specified numeric base.

element.name: Str2QWord.Result
element.short: Value for the specified string as a QWord type.

element.name: Str2QWord.S
element.short: String with the value converted in the routine.

element.name: Str2QWord.Base
element.short: Numeric base (or radix) for the QWord value in the result.

element.name: QWord2Str
element.short: Converts a QWord value using the specified numeric base to its string representation.

element.name: QWord2Str.Result
element.short: String representation for the converted numeric value.

element.name: QWord2Str.N
element.short: QWord value converted to a string in the routine.

element.name: QWord2Str.Base
element.short: Numeric base (or radix) for the specified QWord value.
